item.title: FIR against Prashant Kishore, 700 people for 'organising' BPSC protest without 'permission' - The Times of India
item.description:
FIR against Prashant Kishore, 700 people for 'organising' BPSC protest without 'permission'

Date: October 2023, Source: Various

An FIR has been lodged against political strategist Prashant Kishore and nearly 700 individuals for allegedly organizing a protest related to the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) without necessary permissions.

  • The FIR accuses the group of instigating unrest by protesting without official approval.
  • The protest was aimed at demanding justice for aspirants affected by BPSC examinations.
  • The action has raised questions about the legality of the protest and implications for protesters.
  • Authorities emphasize the importance of obtaining necessary permissions for public demonstrations.
"Public protests must be conducted within the framework of the law to maintain order and safety." - Local Authorities

This incident highlights the ongoing tension between aspirants and examination authorities, stressing the need for clarity in communication and organization during protests.

item.title: Punjab bandh today: Farmers call for shutdown, check what's open and what's closed - India TV News
item.description:
Punjab Bandh Today: Farmers Call for Statewide Shutdown

Date: December 18, 2024
Source: India TV News

Farmers in Punjab have announced a statewide shutdown that is expected to disrupt road and rail traffic. This bandh is part of a protest led by farmer unions demanding important agricultural reforms.

Key Points:

  • Statewide bandh from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.
  • Transportation services, including buses, will be affected.
  • Emergency services will continue to operate despite the bandh.
  • Farmers are demanding legal guarantees for MSP, debt waivers, and more.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“This bandh will force the Centre to accept the demands of farmers.” - Sarvan Singh Pandher

Other unions and groups, including traders and transporters, are supporting the farmers' cause.

This bandh highlights ongoing tensions between farmers and the government regarding agricultural policies and rights.

item.title: Bank Holidays January 2025: Check Full List Of Bank Closure In India - News18
item.description:
Bank Holidays January 2025: Check Full List Of Bank Closure In India

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: News18

The New Year is almost here, and everyone is busy preparing to welcome 2025. If you’re planning to complete any important tasks involving banks in January 2025, it’s important to check the list of holidays in advance. In January, banks will be closed for a total of 15 days, including weekly closures and national or regional holidays.

  • Banks observe holidays on every Sunday and the second and fourth Saturdays of the month.
  • Additional holidays are for festivals and other special occasions.

Bank Holidays January 2025 In India

  • January 1, 2025: New Year’s Day (closed nationwide).
  • January 6, 2025: Guru Gobind Singh Jayanti (closed in Punjab).
  • January 11, 2025: Second Saturday (closed nationwide).
  • January 12, 2025: Sunday (weekly closure).
  • January 13, 2025: Lohri (closed in Punjab and some states).
  • January 14, 2025: Sankranti and Pongal (closed in Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh).
  • January 15, 2025: Thiruvalluvar Day (closed in Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, and Assam).
  • January 23, 2025: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose’s birth anniversary (closed in many states).
  • January 25, 2025: Weekly holiday (closed nationwide).
  • January 26, 2025: Republic Day (closed nationwide).
  • January 30, 2025: Sonam Losar (closed in Sikkim).

For exact holiday details, it’s best to check with your local bank.

item.title: Man sent to judicial custody for assaulting cops - The Times of India
item.description:
Man Sent to Judicial Custody for Assaulting Cops

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

A man has been remanded to judicial custody after allegedly assaulting police officers during an incident.

  • The incident involved multiple police officers.
  • Details of the assault were not fully disclosed.
  • The judicial custody came after court hearings.
The police provided no additional quotes or statistics.

This case highlights ongoing issues regarding assaults on law enforcement personnel.

item.title: China slows down earth's rotation, increases duration of day, displaces north and south poles by just…, plann - India.com
item.description:
China slows down earth's rotation, increases duration of day, displaces north and south poles by just…, planning 3 times more…

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India.com

The construction of China’s Three Gorges Dam has altered the speed of the Earth’s rotation, causing an increase in the duration of a day and a slight shift of the North and South Poles.

  • The Three Gorges Dam reduces the Earth's rotation speed, elongating the day by 0.06 microseconds.
  • China plans to build a new dam three times larger than the current Three Gorges Dam on the Yarlung Zangbo River.
  • The current dam is 2.3 km long, 115 meters wide and 185 meters high, producing 88.2 billion kWh of energy annually.
  • The new project is expected to produce 300 billion kWh of energy.
  • The construction of these dams has environmental implications, including the movement of the poles by 2 cm.
"The speed of rotation of the Earth has slowed down, thus increasing the time of one day..."

This development raises concerns about the environmental impacts of large-scale hydroelectric projects, while also showcasing China's ambition in energy production.

item.title: Uma Thomas suffered injuries in brain, spine, lungs; on ventilator support: Medical bulletin - Onmanorama
item.description:
Uma Thomas Sustains Severe Injuries After Fall; On Ventilator Support

Published: December 29, 2024
Source: Onmanorama

Thrikkakara MLA Uma Thomas is in critical condition following a fall at Kaloor Stadium that led to significant injuries to her brain, spine, and lungs. She is currently under intensive care.

  • Uma Thomas fell from the gallery at Kaloor Stadium.
  • She was found unconscious with a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 8, indicating severe injury.
  • Medical tests revealed a Grade 2 Diffuse Axonal Injury to the brain, along with cervical spine injuries and fractures to her face and ribs.
  • She is currently on a ventilator and undergoing observation and treatment in an ICU.
  • Emergency surgery is not required at this time, according to medical officials.
  • Health experts are monitoring her progress closely with further discussions on her treatment planned.
“There is nothing as alarming as we feared. Her condition is being stabilised.” - Opposition leader VD Satheesan

Medical professionals are optimistic about stabilizing her condition while emphasizing the need for close monitoring in the following hours.

item.title: From lathicharge to water cannons: Bihar police crackdown on protesting BPSC aspirants - The Times of India
item.description:
Bihar Police's Aggressive Response to Protests by BPSC Aspirants

Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: Times of India

In Bihar, a fresh protest by BPSC (Bihar Public Service Commission) aspirants faced a severe crackdown from the police, employing tactics including lathicharges and water cannons, sparking outrage and criticism.

  • Police enforced strict measures against the protestors, leading to numerous injuries.
  • The protest aimed to demand better job opportunities and transparency in the BPSC examination process.
  • Protesters accused the police of excessive force and violation of their rights to peaceful assembly.
"We were only asking for our rights and demanding justice. This is not how a democracy should function," said a protester.

The actions taken by the police have drawn widespread condemnation, raising questions about the treatment of aspirants and the need for reforms in the state's recruitment processes.

item.title: Delhi police nab juvenile accused of stealing ₹16.44 lakh diamond jewellery from Karol Bagh shop - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police Arrest Juvenile for ₹16.44 Lakh Diamond Theft

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Police have apprehended a juvenile suspected of stealing diamond jewellery valued at ₹16.44 lakh from a shop in Karol Bagh.

  • The theft occurred on December 11 during the transportation of 10 diamond necklace sets.
  • The accused allegedly stole two diamond necklace sets and four diamond earring sets.
  • The police located the 17-year-old suspect near New Delhi railway station on December 20 following an extensive search involving analysis of CCTV footage.
  • The stolen jewellery was recovered during the suspect's confession.
  • A separate incident involved the arrest of an 18-year-old and his father for stealing gold jewellery in Ludhiana.
“During interrogation, the juvenile confessed to his involvement in the crime. The stolen jewellery was recovered from his possession,” a police officer revealed.

This case highlights ongoing concerns about thefts in urban areas and the involvement of younger individuals in such crimes.

item.title: Police use water cannon, lathi charge on BPSC protesters in Patna - The Indian Express
item.description:
Police use water cannon and lathi charge on BPSC protesters in Patna

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Hundreds of civil service aspirants in Patna have been protesting the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) prelim examination, demanding a re-examination citing issues during the exam.

  • Bihar Police used water cannons and lathi charge to disperse protesters attempting to breach barricades.
  • Aspirants allege that technical failures during the exam hindered fair administration.
  • Prashant Kishor, a political figure, has backed the students' demands for a fresh examination.
  • Approximately 3.8 lakh students participated in the BPSC prelims on December 13.
  • The BPSC has agreed to reschedule the exam for only one centre where an incident occurred.
“How can BPSC reschedule the examination for just one centre? There should be a level playing amid complaints of delayed distribution of question papers, non-functional CCTV cameras and jammers at several other centres.” - Prashant Kishor

The ongoing protests reflect significant discontent among students regarding the fairness of the examination process, with calls for broad reforms in the BPSC's procedures.

item.title: Nagpur: Peanut seller among 4 involved in illegal conversion of ₹2,000 notes; held - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nagpur Police Arrest Four in ₹2,000 Note Conversion Racket

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nagpur police have arrested a peanut seller and three accomplices involved in a scheme to illegally convert ₹2,000 notes into ₹500 currency.

  • The group allegedly helped individuals exchange now-withdrawn ₹2,000 notes for a commission.
  • Nandalal Maurya, a peanut seller, was hired to operate the racket and assisted in converting currency.
  • The police probe began after a tip-off about the gang's illegal activities.
  • Authorities recovered large sums of cash from the suspects, including ₹60,000 from Maurya's residence.
“Jain promised Maurya ₹200 each for converting 10 notes of ₹2,000 into ₹500 currency notes,” a police officer explained.

The arrests highlight ongoing issues with currency conversion schemes in the wake of the RBI's withdrawal of ₹2,000 notes.

item.title: Congress MLA Uma Thomas suffers serious injuries after 15-feet fall at JLN Stadium, Kerala - The New Indian Express
item.description:
Congress MLA Uma Thomas Injured in 15-Foot Fall at JLN Stadium

Publication Date: 29 Dec 2024 | Source: TNIE

Uma Thomas, Congress MLA of Thrikkakara, fell from a 15-foot-high dais while attending a dance program at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, resulting in serious injuries.

  • The accident occurred when Thomas was heading towards the dais for the inauguration of the event.
  • She lost balance and fell onto a concrete platform, sustaining multiple fractures and bleeding.
  • Her condition is stable but she is currently on a ventilator.
  • A tube will be inserted to drain accumulated blood in her lungs, and a CT scan is needed to assess further injuries.
“MLA was unconscious and profusely bleeding... I was shocked to see her fall from the height.” - Sudheesh, eyewitness

The incident highlights concerns over safety measures at public events and the need for secure barriers.

item.title: Police Lathi Charge, Use Water Cannons On Students Demanding Bihar Public Service Re-Exam - NDTV
item.description:
Police Lathi Charge, Use Water Cannons On Students Demanding Bihar Public Service Re-Exam

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The protest by Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) aspirants escalated today in Patna, leading to police lathi charges and the use of water cannons.

  • Thousands of students protested at Gandhi Maidan demanding a re-test of the 70th CCE.
  • Protesters intended to march towards Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's residence.
  • All India Students' Association (AISA) called for a 'chakka jam' in response to police force.
  • Prashant Kishor supported the protest, proposing a meeting to discuss their demands.
  • Protests have been ongoing for over 10 days, triggered by allegations of a paper leak.
  • BPSC maintains that only isolated irregularities occurred and the exam will not be canceled.
“If no concrete decision is reached, the students will resume protesting the following day.” — Prashant Kishor

The BPSC stated the main examination will proceed as scheduled in April while advising candidates to focus on their preparations.

item.title: 26-year-old from Delhi loses consciousness during music fest in Goa, dies a day later - The Indian Express
item.description:
26-Year-Old from Delhi Dies After Losing Consciousness at Goa EDM Festival

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

A 26-year-old man from Delhi died in Goa after he fell unconscious during an EDM festival. Despite being transported to a hospital for treatment, he was declared dead the following day.

  • The deceased, identified as Karan Kashyap from Rohini, attended the Sunburn EDM party in Pernem, Goa.
  • He became unconscious around 9:45 pm and was taken to Vision Hospital in Mapusa.
  • The cause of death is currently unknown, with samples preserved for analysis.
  • A postmortem is being conducted at Goa Medical College.
  • Police have stated that legal action will follow if foul play is determined.
“The postmortem is being conducted at Goa Medical College and necessary legal action will be taken if any foul play is noticed.” - North Goa SP Akshat Kaushal

This incident highlights the potential dangers associated with large musical events and the need for thorough investigations into unexpected deaths.

item.title: India’s newest Russia-built warship to reach country in mid-Feb - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India’s Newest Russia-Built Warship to Reach Country in Mid-Feb

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

INS Tushil, India's latest stealth missile frigate, is expected to arrive on the western coast in mid-February following its commissioning in Russia. It symbolizes India's expanding naval capabilities.

  • The warship was commissioned on December 9 at Yantar Shipyard in Russia.
  • It will be part of the Mumbai-based Western Fleet.
  • INS Tushil previously arrived at Casablanca, Morocco, to enhance bilateral naval relations.
  • It will conduct anti-piracy patrols in the Gulf of Guinea before reaching India.
  • The frigate features 26% indigenous content, more than previous models.
  • Part of a $2.5 billion deal with Russia for additional Krivak/Talwar class frigates.
“INS Tushil is a proud testament to India’s growing maritime might.” — Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

In conclusion, INS Tushil represents a significant advancement in India's naval capability and strengthens its international partnerships.

item.title: U.S.-India ties will be strengthened, but expect tariff trouble, FTA push: Former Ambassador Juster - The Hindu
item.description:
Strengthening U.S.-India Relations Amid Tariff Challenges: Insights from Former Ambassador Juster

Publication Date: Recent Interview, Source: The Hindu

In an interview, former U.S. Ambassador to India, Kenneth Juster, discusses the potential for strengthened U.S.-India relations as President Trump embarks on his second term. He anticipates increased tariffs and renewed efforts to finalize a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) while addressing various issues that could pose challenges in the relationship.

The interview highlights key points concerning trade, sanctions, and geopolitical dynamics in the Indo-Pacific region.

  • Expectations of raised tariffs from the U.S.
  • Renewed push for a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with India.
  • Challenges include high tariffs and market access for U.S. agricultural exports.
  • Focus on cooperative countermeasures against China as a strategic challenge.
  • Possibility of continued investigations without substantial impact on U.S.-India relationships.
  • Discussion on the evolving ease of doing business in India.
“I think there’s going to be a very strong U.S.-Indian relationship during the second term of the Trump presidency... U.S.-India relations were among the highlights of the Trump administration’s foreign policy.” - Kenneth Juster

In conclusion, Juster emphasizes the positive trajectory of U.S.-India relations founded on previous administrations’ successes, with technology and defense cooperation expected to remain pivotal.

item.title: Why two suicides have opened a can of worms for Congress in Priyanka Gandhi’s constituency - The Indian Express
item.description:
Political Turmoil in Wayanad: Suicides Linked to Alleged Job Fraud

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

The recent suspected suicides of local Congress leader N M Vijayan and his son Jijesh have sparked a political crisis in Wayanad, invoking accusations of corruption involving senior Congress officials.

  • The deaths are alleged to be tied to a cash-for-job scam involving Congress leaders.
  • CPI(M) and BJP have demanded accountability and called for investigation into the circumstances of the deaths.
  • Allegations suggest Vijayan was involved in collecting large sums of money from job seekers, promising them positions at a cooperative bank.
  • No suicide note has been found, but family and political connections indicate a history of financial distress.
  • A controversial job agreement has emerged, reportedly implicating Congress leaders, including MLA I C Balakrishnan.
  • Balakrishnan denies the allegations, claiming the document is fabricated and demanding investigation.
  • The Congress party has initiated its internal probe into the incidents.
“The father-son duo is the latest victim of the fraud in cooperative banks of the state.” - K Surendran, Kerala BJP President

The unfolding situation underscores significant political ramifications for the Congress party, particularly in the crucial constituency represented by Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.
